hopobject.name: Page
hopobject.body: I'm retired betterpharmacare.net Coogan said it was important to inject a note of comedy into the harrowing story â "you need some relief from it â¦ to sugar the pill" â but not to go too far. "It was important we didn't go overboard with it. I asked Stephen [Frears] to keep an eye on me, to tell me to tone it down if my face became too animated. It was important not to trivialise it." Coogan also said he was as interested in the relationship between journalist and story as about the lost child. "I wanted the film to be about him and his relationship with Philomena, and make it about a middle-aged, well educated cynic and a working-class Irish woman who was far less cynical."
